snippet: Janet Yellen, the vice chairwoman of the Federal Reserve, said the country’s lackluster recovery could require an emphasis on growth, not inflation, beyond 2014.
abstract: Federal Reserve vice chairwoman Janet L Yellen says that the lackluster trajectory of the economic recovery might require the Fed to continue its efforts to bolster growth beyond the end of 2014.
lead_paragraph: Janet Yellen, the vice chairwoman of the Federal Reserve, said the country’s lackluster recovery could require an emphasis on growth, not inflation, beyond 2014.

headline.seo: Yellen Says Fed May Need to Extend Support Past 2014
headline.main: Fed May Extend Support Past 2014, Official Says
headline.print_headline: Fed May Extend Support Past 2014, Official Says
